exercise.name: Hands Bike
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves upper-body cardiovascular endurance using cycling mechanics.

executionSteps.step: Sit on the bike and grip the handles.
Start pedaling with your arms in a controlled motion.
Maintain consistent resistance and rhythm.
Keep shoulders relaxed and core active.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using momentum instead of controlled movement.

exercise.name: Squat Tuck Jump
exercise.whatItDoes: Boosts explosive strength, agility, and cardiovascular power.

executionSteps.step: Lower into a deep squat position.
Explode upward into a jump.
Tuck your knees toward your chest mid-air.
Land softly and repeat immediately.

exercise.name: Step Up with Knee Raises
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves lower-body strength, balance, and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Step onto the platform with one foot.
Drive the opposite knee upward.
Lower back down and repeat on the other side.
Maintain steady rhythm and upright posture.

exercise.name: Snap Jumps
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves explosive power, agility, and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Start in a standing position with feet hip-width apart.
Drop quickly into a quarter squat.
Explosively jump upward while snapping legs together.
Land softly and immediately repeat.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not absorbing impact with knees slightly bent.

exercise.name: High Knee Run
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves speed, cardio endurance, and hip flexor strength.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall with hands at your sides.
Drive your knees upward one at a time as fast as possible.
Pump arms in coordination with legs.
Maintain an upright posture throughout.

exercise.name: High Knee Skips
exercise.whatItDoes: Enhances coordination, cardio endurance, and explosive lower-body power.

executionSteps.step: Stand upright with arms at your sides.
Skip forward while lifting your knee high.
Drive opposite arm upward with each skip.
Maintain a rhythmic and controlled motion.

commonMistakes.mistake: Landing too hard on the feet.
Failing to coordinate arm and leg movement.

exercise.name: Assault AirBike
exercise.whatItDoes: Provides a full-body cardio workout combining upper and lower body motion.

executionSteps.step: Sit on the seat and grab the handles firmly.
Begin pedaling while pushing and pulling the handles.
Maintain an upright torso and steady pace.
Increase speed gradually to raise heart rate.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using only legs or only arms instead of both.

exercise.name: Recumbent Exercise Bike
exercise.whatItDoes: Provides low-impact cardiovascular exercise suitable for beginners and those with joint issues.

executionSteps.step: Sit back into the seat and place your feet on the pedals.
Adjust seat distance to maintain slight knee bend.
Begin pedaling at a controlled pace.
Increase resistance gradually as needed.

commonMistakes.mistake: Sitting too far or too close to the pedals.
Slouching the back instead of maintaining posture.

exercise.name: The Box Jump
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds explosive power, leg strength, and high-intensity cardio endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand facing the box with feet shoulder-width apart.
Lower into a half squat and swing arms backward.
Explosively jump onto the box, landing softly.
Step down carefully and repeat.

exercise.name: Battle Rope
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves full-body conditioning, strengthens arms and core, and boosts cardiovascular performance.

executionSteps.step: Stand with knees slightly bent and hold the rope ends.
Keep core engaged and chest upright.
Move arms up and down to create waves in the rope.
Maintain steady breathing and controlled rhythm.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using lower back instead of core.

exercise.name: Vibration Plate
exercise.whatItDoes: Enhances muscle activation and circulation through vibration.

executionSteps.step: Stand with knees slightly bent on the vibration plate.
Maintain balance and engage your core.
Hold the position while the plate vibrates.

exercise.name: Vertical Mountain Climber
exercise.whatItDoes: Boosts cardio and strengthens lower body and core.

executionSteps.step: Stand upright with hands reaching overhead.
Drive one knee upward while pulling hands down.
Alternate legs rapidly in a climbing motion.

exercise.name: Cross Body Push-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds upper-body explosiveness and shoulder stability.

executionSteps.step: Start in a push-up position.
Lower your chest to the floor.
Explode upward and move hands diagonally to opposite sides.
Repeat with controlled landing.

exercise.name: Box Jump to Pistol Squat
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves balance, leg strength, and plyometric power.

executionSteps.step: Jump onto the box with both feet.
Stabilize and perform a single-leg pistol squat.
Return to standing and step down.

exercise.name: Box Jump 2 to 1
exercise.whatItDoes: Develops unilateral leg strength and explosive power.

executionSteps.step: Jump onto the box with two feet.
Land and balance on one leg.
Step down safely.

exercise.name: Box Jump 1 to 2
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves explosive strength and dynamic balance.

executionSteps.step: Jump onto the box from a single-leg stance.
Land on both feet with control.
Step down carefully.

exercise.name: Single Leg Box Jump
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens single-leg explosiveness and balance.

executionSteps.step: Stand on one leg in front of the box.
Jump explosively onto the box.
Land on the same leg and balance.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using momentum instead of leg power.

exercise.name: Stationary Bike Run
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves lower-body endurance and cardiovascular fitness.

executionSteps.step: Sit on the bike with proper seat height.
Pedal at a fast but controlled pace.
Maintain steady breathing.

exercise.name: Jack Burpees
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves total-body strength, explosiveness, and cardio endurance.

executionSteps.step: Begin standing with feet together.
Drop into a squat, kick legs back, and perform a push-up.
Jump feet outward like a jumping jack.
Hop back to center and explode upward.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not fully extending the legs during the jack.

exercise.name: Astride Jumps
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds explosive lower-body power and improves agility.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet hip-width apart.
Jump outward into a wide stance.
Immediately jump back to starting position.
Repeat with quick, controlled movements.

exercise.name: Long Jump
exercise.whatItDoes: Develops lower-body explosive power and coordination.

executionSteps.step: Start in a partial squat stance.
Swing arms back and jump forward as far as possible.
Land softly with knees bent.

exercise.name: Front Plank With Arm And Leg Lift
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens the core, glutes, and stabilizer muscles.

executionSteps.step: Start in a plank position.
Lift one arm and the opposite leg simultaneously.
Hold briefly, then switch sides.

exercise.name: Kettlebell Clean and Jerk
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds strength, power, and endurance across the entire body.

executionSteps.step: Pull the kettlebell up into rack position.
Dip slightly and drive it overhead.
Lower with control and repeat.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using the arms instead of hip drive.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Burpees
exercise.whatItDoes: Increases full-body strength, explosiveness, and conditioning.

executionSteps.step: Hold dumbbells at your sides.
Drop into a plank by placing dumbbells on the ground.
Perform a push-up.
Jump feet forward and explosively stand.

exercise.name: Ski Step
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves coordination and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand upright with arms slightly bent.
Step side to side in a skiing motion.
Move arms opposite to your legs.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Split Jump
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds explosive leg strength and balance.

executionSteps.step: Hold dumbbells at your sides.
Drop into a lunge and explode upward.
Switch legs midair and land softly.

exercise.name: Dumbbell Jump Squat
exercise.whatItDoes: Increases explosive power in legs and glutes.

executionSteps.step: Hold dumbbells at your sides.
Lower into a squat.
Explode upward into a jump.

exercise.name: Burpees
exercise.whatItDoes: Boosts strength, endurance, and cardiovascular fitness.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
Drop into a squat and kick legs back.
Perform a push-up.
Hop forward and jump explosively upward.

exercise.name: High Knee Squat
exercise.whatItDoes: Boosts heart rate while strengthening legs and improving coordination.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
Lift one knee high toward your chest.
Perform a squat immediately after the knee lift.
Alternate knees and repeat continuously.

exercise.name: Boxer Shuffle
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves footwork, agility, and overall cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand in a light boxing stance.
Shift weight from one foot to the other.
Stay light on your toes and move continuously.
Maintain a relaxed upper body.

exercise.name: Jab Boxing
exercise.whatItDoes: Enhances arm speed, improves coordination, and increases heart rate.

executionSteps.step: Stand in a boxing stance.
Extend your lead hand straight forward.
Retract the punch swiftly.
Repeat with controlled speed.

exercise.name: Punches
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves upper-body endurance and cardiovascular fitness.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Throw alternating punches forward.
Rotate your torso slightly with each punch.
Maintain a steady pace.

exercise.name: Right Uppercut
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens shoulders and core while boosting cardio activity.

executionSteps.step: Stand in a boxing stance.
Bend knees slightly and rotate hips.
Drive your right fist upward in a scooping motion.
Return to guard and repeat.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using only the arm instead of the whole body.

exercise.name: Right Cross
exercise.whatItDoes: Develops power, coordination, and cardiovascular performance.

executionSteps.step: Stand in fighting position.
Rotate hips and shoulders.
Extend your right arm forward forcefully.
Return to guard immediately.

exercise.name: Hook Kick
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves lower-body strength, agility, and balance.

executionSteps.step: Stand in a fighting stance.
Lift your knee up sideways.
Extend your leg outward in a hooking motion.
Return to stance and repeat.

exercise.name: Boxing Right Cross
exercise.whatItDoes: Increases punching power, coordination, and cardio intensity.

executionSteps.step: Stand in boxing stance.
Twist your hips and shoulders.
Throw a powerful right cross punch.
Reset to guard position.

exercise.name: Walking High Knee Lunges
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens legs, improves balance, and boosts cardiovascular output.

executionSteps.step: Step forward into a lunge.
Push through the front leg and lift the opposite knee high.
Step forward into the next lunge.
Repeat walking movement.

exercise.name: High Knees Run
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves cardio endurance and strengthens hip flexors and core.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Run in place while lifting knees to waist height.
Pump your arms for momentum.
Maintain a steady rhythm.

exercise.name: Spider Plank
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens the core and elevates heart rate with controlled movement.

executionSteps.step: Start in a plank position.
Bring one knee toward the elbow on the same side.
Return to plank and alternate sides.
Maintain a steady rhythm.

exercise.name: Run in Place
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves cardio endurance and warms up the whole body.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall with relaxed shoulders.
Begin jogging in place.
Lift your knees slightly and swing your arms.
Maintain a consistent pace.

exercise.name: Jump Squats
exercise.whatItDoes: Boosts explosive power, strengthens legs, and elevates heart rate rapidly.

executionSteps.step: Begin in a squat position.
Explosively jump upward.
Land softly back into the squat.
Repeat in a controlled rhythm.

exercise.name: Short Stride Run
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves foot speed, stamina, and cardiovascular performance.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall and begin running with short, quick steps.
Keep your feet close to the ground.
Maintain quick turnover.
Use your arms for balance and rhythm.

exercise.name: Lateral Step-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens legs and glutes while improving side-to-side movement.

executionSteps.step: Stand beside a step platform.
Step up sideways with the nearest foot.
Bring the other foot up to meet it.
Step back down and repeat.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using momentum instead of muscle control.

exercise.name: Step Up with Opposite Elbow to Knee Twist
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves coordination, core activation, and cardiovascular fitness.

executionSteps.step: Step up onto a platform.
Lift your opposite knee upward.
Twist and bring elbow toward knee.
Step down and alternate sides.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not fully stepping onto the platform.

exercise.name: Band Assisted Sprinter Run
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves sprint mechanics, explosiveness, and cardio output.

executionSteps.step: Attach the band around your waist with a partner holding it.
Lean slightly forward.
Drive your knees quickly in a sprinting motion.
Maintain strong arm swings.

exercise.name: Backward Running
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds balance, agility, and strengthens leg muscles differently than forward running.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall and look straight ahead.
Begin jogging backward with short steps.
Keep your core engaged.
Maintain a safe pace.

exercise.name: Side Shuttle
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves lateral speed, agility, and footwork.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Shuffle quickly to one side.
Touch the ground or imaginary marker.
Shuffle to the opposite side.

exercise.name: Tuck Jump
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds explosive power and elevates heart rate extremely fast.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Jump upward explosively.
Tuck knees toward chest.
Land softly and repeat.

exercise.name: T-Cross Sit-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens core, improves rotational movement, and elevates heart rate.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with arms extended.
Perform a sit-up and rotate torso to one side, forming a T.
Return to starting position and alternate sides.
Maintain controlled movement.

exercise.name: Power Skips
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves leg power, coordination, and cardiovascular fitness.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall and prepare to skip forward explosively.
Drive knees high while swinging opposite arms.
Land softly and repeat continuously.

exercise.name: Plyo Jacks
exercise.whatItDoes: Boosts explosive leg power and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet together and arms at sides.
Jump feet out while raising arms overhead.
Jump back to starting position.
Repeat quickly and controlled.

exercise.name: Split Jacks
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves leg power, coordination, and elevates heart rate.

executionSteps.step: Stand in a small squat position.
Jump legs into a split stance while raising arms.
Return to starting position.
Repeat continuously.

exercise.name: Butt Kicks
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves hamstring flexibility and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall and start jogging in place.
Kick heels toward glutes.
Swing arms naturally.
Keep a steady pace.

exercise.name: Fast Feet Run
exercise.whatItDoes: Enhances foot speed, coordination, and cardiovascular performance.

executionSteps.step: Stand with knees slightly bent.
Run in place rapidly, lifting feet slightly off the ground.
Keep arms moving for balance.
Maintain quick pace.

exercise.name: Wheel Run
exercise.whatItDoes: Boosts agility, coordination, and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand in a neutral position.
Run in a circular motion as if spinning a wheel.
Maintain light, fast steps.
Keep arms moving for rhythm.

exercise.name: Zig Zag Hops Plyometric
exercise.whatItDoes: Develops explosive leg power, agility, and cardiovascular fitness.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet together.
Jump side-to-side in a zig-zag pattern.
Land softly on the balls of feet.
Repeat quickly and controlled.

exercise.name: Bodyweight Squat
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens legs and glutes while slightly elevating heart rate.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Lower hips down and back into a squat.
Keep chest up and knees behind toes.
Return to standing and repeat.

exercise.name: Lateral Speed Step
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves lateral speed, agility, and cardiovascular fitness.

executionSteps.step: Stand in a slight squat position.
Step quickly side-to-side with small, fast steps.
Keep torso stable.
Maintain continuous movement.

exercise.name: Curtsy Squat
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets glutes, thighs, and improves balance.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet hip-width apart.
Step one leg diagonally behind into a curtsy.
Lower into a squat and return to standing.
Alternate legs.

exercise.name: Split Jump Squat
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds explosive leg power, glutes, and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Start in a lunge position.
Jump explosively, switching legs in the air.
Land softly into a lunge with opposite leg forward.
Repeat continuously.

exercise.name: Backward Jump
exercise.whatItDoes: Enhances leg power, coordination, and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Jump backward explosively.
Land softly on both feet.
Repeat continuously.

exercise.name: Jumping Jack
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves cardiovascular endurance and warms up the body.

executionSteps.step: Stand upright with feet together.
Jump feet out while swinging arms overhead.
Jump back to starting position.
Repeat continuously.

exercise.name: Single Leg Broad Jump
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds explosive single-leg power and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand on one leg with knee slightly bent.
Jump forward as far as possible.
Land softly on the same leg.
Repeat for set time and switch legs.

exercise.name: Power Lunge
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds explosive leg power, glutes, and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Step forward into a lunge, lowering your back knee toward the ground.
Push explosively off the front foot to return to standing.
Alternate legs and repeat.

exercise.name: Shadow Boxing
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves cardio, coordination, and upper body endurance.

executionSteps.step: Stand in a fighting stance with knees slightly bent.
Throw punches in the air, alternating hands.
Keep movements controlled and maintain footwork.
Repeat continuously.

exercise.name: Walking
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves cardiovascular health and joint mobility.

executionSteps.step: Stand tall and start walking in place or around the room.
Swing arms naturally for rhythm.
Maintain steady pace.

exercise.name: Briskly Walking
exercise.whatItDoes: Increases heart rate and burns more calories than regular walking.

executionSteps.step: Walk in place or around the room at a faster pace.
Maintain straight posture and engage core.
Swing arms naturally.

exercise.name: Running
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves cardiovascular endurance, leg strength, and coordination.

executionSteps.step: Run in place or in a safe indoor area.
Lift knees moderately high.
Keep arms swinging for rhythm.
Maintain steady breathing.

exercises.exercise:
Walk Wave Machine Male Femalez Cardio
Machine
https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=walk+wave+machine+exercise https://img.icons8.com/color/96/treadmill.png https://fitnessprogramer.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/Walk-Wave-Machine.gif 35 Normal Overweight Beginner Improves cardiovascular fitness and lower body endurance.
Walk on the wave machine at steady pace. Keep posture upright. Use arm movement for balance.
Slouching forward. Using machine incorrectly.

exercise.name: Jump Rope
exercise.whatItDoes: Boosts cardiovascular endurance, coordination, and leg power.

executionSteps.step: Hold rope handles and swing rope over head.
Jump over the rope as it reaches feet.
Keep core tight and pace steady.

exercise.name: Bike
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves leg strength and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Sit on bike seat with feet on pedals.
Pedal continuously at a steady pace.
Engage core to maintain posture.

exercise.name: Treadmill
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves cardiovascular endurance and leg strength.

executionSteps.step: Walk or run at a steady pace on the treadmill.
Maintain upright posture.
Engage core for stability.

exercise.name: Incline Treadmill
exercise.whatItDoes: Increases leg and glute strength while boosting cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Set treadmill to an incline.
Walk or jog at steady pace.
Maintain upright posture and engage core.

exercise.name: Rowing Machine
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens back, arms, legs, and improves cardiovascular fitness.

executionSteps.step: Sit on the rowing machine with feet strapped in.
Pull handle towards chest while extending legs.
Return to start position smoothly.
Repeat at steady pace.

exercise.name: Manual Treadmill
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves leg strength and cardiovascular endurance with self-powered motion.

executionSteps.step: Stand on treadmill and walk/run by moving the belt with feet.
Maintain upright posture.
Use arm swing for balance.

exercise.name: Elliptical Machine
exercise.whatItDoes: Works legs, arms, and improves cardio with low-impact motion.

executionSteps.step: Stand on pedals and hold handles.
Move legs and arms in smooth elliptical motion.
Maintain steady pace.

exercise.name: Stair Climber Machine
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens legs, glutes, and improves cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Step continuously on machine pedals.
Maintain upright posture and engage core.
Use handrails lightly if needed.

exercise.name: Elbow To Knee Twists
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens obliques and improves core stability.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back with hands behind head.
Bring right elbow to left knee while extending right leg.
Alternate sides continuously.

exercise.name: Push-up Toe Touch
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds chest, shoulders, core stability, and coordination.

executionSteps.step: Perform a push-up.
At the top, touch right hand to left foot, then left hand to right foot.
Maintain steady rhythm and core engagement.

exercise.name: Mountain Climber
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves core strength, agility, and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Start in a push-up position.
Drive knees alternately towards chest quickly.
Maintain steady rhythm and core tightness.

exercise.name: Bicycle Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets abs and obliques while improving core strength.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, hands behind head.
Bring right elbow to left knee while extending right leg.
Alternate sides continuously.

exercise.name: Navy Seal Burpee
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds full-body strength, explosive power, and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Start standing, drop into a push-up position.
Perform a push-up, then jump feet forward to hands.
Explosively jump upward and repeat.

exercise.name: Navy Seal Burpee
exercise.whatItDoes: A high-intensity full-body exercise that combines burpees, multiple push-ups, and explosive jumps to build strength, endurance, and cardiovascular fitness.

executionSteps.step: Start standing, then squat down and place your hands on the floor.
Jump your feet back into a plank position and perform three push-ups.
Jump your feet back toward your hands and explosively jump upward.
Land softly and move directly into the next repetition.

commonMistakes.mistake: Letting hips sag during the plank or push-up phase.
Rushing the movement and losing proper form.
Landing hard with locked knees after the jump.

exercise.name: Wall Walk
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds shoulder strength, core stability, and full-body control while preparing the body for advanced inverted movements.

executionSteps.step: Begin in a plank position with feet against the wall.
Walk your feet up the wall while moving your hands closer to the wall.
Continue until your body is nearly vertical and chest is close to the wall.
Slowly walk back down with controlled movement.

commonMistakes.mistake: Overarching the lower back instead of engaging the core.
Moving too quickly and losing balance or control.
Letting shoulders shrug up toward the ears.

exercise.name: Push-up Toe Touch
exercise.whatItDoes: Combines push-up strength with dynamic core activation to improve upper-body strength, balance, and coordination.

executionSteps.step: Begin in a standard push-up position.
Lower your body and complete a full push-up.
At the top, lift one hand and the opposite foot to touch hand to toe.
Return to plank and alternate sides with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Letting hips sag during the toe-touch phase.
Failing to complete the full push-up range.
Moving too fast and losing balance.

exercise.name: Burpees
exercise.whatItDoes: A classic full-body conditioning exercise that combines squatting, pushing, and jumping to boost calorie burn, strength, and cardiovascular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Start standing, then squat down and place your hands on the floor.
Jump your feet back into a plank position and perform a push-up.
Jump your feet back toward your hands and explode upward into a jump.
Land softly and move directly into the next repetition.

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing the back to sag or arch during the plank phase.
Skipping the push-up or using partial range of motion.
Landing hard without bending the knees.

exercise.name: Cross Body Push-up
exercise.whatItDoes: A dynamic push-up variation that builds chest and arm strength while engaging the core and obliques through rotational movement.

executionSteps.step: Begin in a standard push-up position.
Lower your chest toward the floor with control.
Push up explosively and drive one knee across your body toward the opposite elbow.
Return to plank and alternate sides.

commonMistakes.mistake: Letting hips sag during the rotational movement.
Not lowering the chest fully during the push-up.

exercise.name: Snap Jumps
exercise.whatItDoes: A fast-paced cardio exercise that spikes heart rate and improves lower-body power while strengthening the core.

executionSteps.step: Begin in a high plank position with hands under shoulders.
Explosively snap both knees toward your chest.
Quickly return your feet back to the plank position.
Continue repeating at a fast but controlled pace.

commonMistakes.mistake: Letting hips sag or lifting them too high.
Not driving knees fully toward the chest.
Losing core tension and bouncing excessively.

exercise.name: Modified Hindu Push-up
exercise.whatItDoes: A flowing push-up variation that improves shoulder mobility, chest and arm strength, and overall body control.

executionSteps.step: Begin in a downward dog position with hips lifted.
Dive your chest forward and down into an upward dog position.
Press through your hands and push hips back to downward dog.
Repeat the movement smoothly and continuously.

commonMistakes.mistake: Letting the lower back sag excessively in the upward dog position.
Failing to fully extend the hips in downward dog.
Moving too fast and losing the fluid motion.

exercise.name: Planche Push-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: An extremely demanding pushing movement that develops exceptional shoulder, chest, arm, and core strength through full-body tension.

executionSteps.step: Begin in a planche lean or full planche position.
Bend the elbows to lower your chest toward your hands.
Press powerfully back up while maintaining full-body tension.
Keep the body parallel to the ground throughout the movement.

commonMistakes.mistake: Letting the hips rise during the descent.
Not leaning far enough forward to maintain balance.
Bending at the hips instead of the elbows.

exercise.name: Archer Push-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: A challenging unilateral push-up variation that increases strength and control on each side while progressing toward one-arm push-ups.

executionSteps.step: Begin in a wide push-up position.
Lower your chest toward one hand while keeping the opposite arm straight.
Push back up using the working arm.
Alternate sides with each repetition.

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing the hips or torso to rotate.
Bending the assisting arm instead of keeping it straight.
Not lowering fully on the working side.

exercise.name: Swimming
exercise.whatItDoes: A prone bodyweight movement that strengthens the trapezius, rear shoulders, and upper back while improving postural endurance.

executionSteps.step: Lie face down with arms extended overhead.
Lift your chest slightly off the floor.
Alternate pulling each arm back as if performing a freestyle swim stroke.
Maintain controlled, rhythmic movement throughout.

commonMistakes.mistake: Lifting the head excessively instead of keeping the neck neutral.
Moving too fast without muscle control.

exercise.name: Push-Up Plus
exercise.whatItDoes: A controlled push-up variation that strengthens the serratus anterior and lower trapezius to improve shoulder stability.

executionSteps.step: Begin in a standard push-up position.
Lower your body and complete a full push-up.
At the top, push the floor away to protract the shoulder blades.
Return slightly, then repeat the movement.

commonMistakes.mistake: Letting the hips sag during the movement.
Not completing the full push-up range.
Shrugging the shoulders instead of protracting them.

exercise.name: Hindu Push-ups
exercise.whatItDoes: A flowing push-up variation that improves shoulder mobility, upper-body strength, and muscular endurance.

executionSteps.step: Start in a downward dog position.
Dive your chest forward and lower into an upward dog position.
Press through your hands and push back to downward dog.
Repeat the movement smoothly and continuously.

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing the lower back to sag in the upward dog position.
Rushing the transitions instead of moving fluidly.
Not using the full range of motion.

exercise.name: Drop Push-Up
exercise.whatItDoes: An explosive plyometric push-up that builds powerful chest, shoulder, and triceps strength while improving reactive control.

executionSteps.step: Start in a push-up position with hands elevated on a box or step.
Drop your hands quickly to the floor.
Absorb the impact and immediately press explosively upward.
Land softly with control and repeat.

commonMistakes.mistake: Arching the lower back upon impact.

exercise.name: Lying Upper Body Rotation
exercise.whatItDoes: A gentle thoracic rotation stretch that improves chest openness, spinal mobility, and upper-body relaxation.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your side with knees bent and stacked.
Extend both arms straight in front of you.
Rotate the top arm open toward the opposite side.
Hold briefly, then return and switch sides.

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing the hips or knees to lift off the floor.
Forcing the rotation beyond a comfortable range.
Holding the breath during the stretch.

exercise.name: Supine Spinal Twist
exercise.whatItDoes: A gentle spinal rotation stretch that improves lower-back mobility, reduces stiffness, and promotes relaxation.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back and bring your knees toward your chest.
Lower both knees to one side while keeping shoulders on the floor.
Extend your arms out to the sides for support.
Hold briefly, then switch to the other side.

commonMistakes.mistake: Forcing the twist beyond a comfortable range.
Allowing shoulders to lift off the floor.
Holding the breath during the stretch.

exercise.name: Triceps Dips on Floor
exercise.whatItDoes: A simple bodyweight exercise that targets the triceps while also engaging the shoulders and core for support.

executionSteps.step: Sit on the floor with hands placed behind you.
Lift your hips off the floor.
Bend your elbows to lower your body down.
Press through your hands to return to the starting position.

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing the hips to sag during the movement.
Using only a partial range of motion.

exercise.name: Body Ups
exercise.whatItDoes: A challenging bodyweight movement that targets the triceps by extending and flexing the arms while maintaining a strong plank position.

executionSteps.step: Start in a strong plank position.
Push your body forward using your arms.
Control the movement as you return to plank.
Repeat with steady tempo.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using only a partial range of motion.

exercise.name: Dragon Flag
exercise.whatItDoes: An extremely advanced bodyweight core exercise that powerfully targets the entire abdominal wall and hip flexors.

executionSteps.step: Lie on a bench and grip behind your head for support.
Lift your body into a straight line supported by your upper back.
Slowly lower your body while keeping it rigid.
Raise back up using core control.

exercise.name: Cross Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the obliques and rectus abdominis through rotational movement to improve core definition.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with knees bent and hands behind your head.
Lift one shoulder and rotate to bring the opposite elbow toward the knee.
Squeeze the oblique at the top.
Lower down and alternate sides.

exercise.name: Cross Body Mountain Climber
exercise.whatItDoes: Increases heart rate while targeting the obliques and entire core through a dynamic rotational motion.

executionSteps.step: Start in a high plank position.
Bring one knee across the body toward the opposite elbow.
Quickly alternate sides while keeping hips low.
Maintain a tight and engaged core.

exercise.name: Alternate Leg Raises
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the lower abdominal muscles and hip flexors using controlled alternating leg movement.

executionSteps.step: Lie flat on your back with hands under hips or by your sides.
Lift one straight leg upward while keeping the other on the ground.
Lower the raised leg and switch sides.
Move slowly and keep the core engaged.

commonMistakes.mistake: Arching the lower back off the floor.

exercise.name: Crunches
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens the upper abdominal muscles by flexing the spine through controlled core contraction.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Place hands lightly behind the head.
Contract the abs to lift shoulders off the ground.
Lower slowly with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling the neck with the hands.
Turning the movement into a full sit-up.

exercise.name: Mountain Climber
exercise.whatItDoes: Dynamic core exercise that elevates heart rate while strengthening the entire abdominal region.

executionSteps.step: Start in a high plank position.
Drive one knee toward the chest.
Quickly switch legs in a running motion.
Keep core tight and hips low throughout.

exercise.name: Bicycle Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the obliques and rectus abdominis through a controlled crunch combined with rotational movement.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with hands behind your head and legs lifted.
Bring one elbow toward the opposite knee while extending the other leg.
Switch sides in a smooth pedaling motion.
Focus on full rotation and core engagement.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling on the neck with the hands.
Reducing range of motion without full twist.
Moving too fast and losing control.

exercise.name: Lying Scissor Kick
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the lower abdominals and hip flexors using a controlled scissoring motion to build core endurance.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with hands placed under your hips for support.
Lift both legs slightly off the ground.
Alternate crossing one leg over the other in a scissor motion.
Keep the core tight and lower back pressed into the floor.

commonMistakes.mistake: Arching the lower back off the floor.
Raising legs too high and reducing tension.

exercise.name: Leg Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the lower abdominal muscles and hip flexors to improve core strength and control.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with hands placed under your hips for support.
Lift both legs straight up toward the ceiling.
Slowly lower the legs without letting them touch the floor.
Keep the lower back pressed firmly into the ground.

commonMistakes.mistake: Bending the knees during the movement.

exercise.name: Oblique Floor Crunches
exercise.whatItDoes: Isolates the oblique muscles to improve side abdominal strength and rotational control.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Lift your shoulders and twist your torso to one side.
Lower back down with control.
Alternate sides while focusing on oblique contraction.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling on the head or neck.

exercise.name: T-Cross Sit-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the upper abdominals and obliques through a combined sit-up and cross-body rotation.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with arms extended out to the sides in a T position.
Sit up while reaching one hand toward the opposite foot.
Lower back down with control.
Alternate sides on each repetition.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using arm swing to generate momentum.
Failing to rotate fully across the body.

exercise.name: Dead Bug
exercise.whatItDoes: Improves core stability and coordination while helping protect the lower back through controlled opposite-limb movement.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with arms extended upward and knees bent at 90 degrees.
Extend the opposite arm and leg while keeping your lower back pressed into the floor.
Return to the starting position with control.
Alternate sides while moving slowly and deliberately.

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing the lower back to arch off the floor.
Moving too fast and losing control.
Not fully extending the arm and leg.

exercise.name: Decline Sit-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Increases resistance on the abdominal muscles by using a decline angle, enhancing upper ab strength and core control.

executionSteps.step: Secure your feet on the decline bench and lie back fully.
Engage your core and sit up using your abdominal muscles.
Squeeze the abs briefly at the top.
Lower yourself back down slowly with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Relying too much on hip flexors instead of abs.
Straining or pulling on the neck.

exercise.name: Heel Touch
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets the oblique muscles through a controlled side-to-side crunching motion to improve core endurance.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Lift shoulders slightly off the ground.
Reach one hand toward the same-side heel.
Alternate sides in a smooth, continuous motion.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not engaging the abs and only reaching with the arms.
Moving too fast and losing control.

exercise.name: Crunch With Leg Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Activates both upper and lower abdominal muscles simultaneously, improving overall core strength and control.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with legs extended straight up toward the ceiling.
Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the floor into a crunch.
Squeeze the abs at the top while keeping legs raised.
Lower your shoulders back down with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling on the neck instead of using the abs.
Letting the legs drop during the movement.
Using momentum rather than controlled motion.

exercise.name: Alternate Lying Floor Leg Raise
exercise.whatItDoes: Focuses on the lower abdominal muscles while improving core stability through controlled alternating leg lifts.

executionSteps.step: Lie flat on your back with hands placed under your hips for support.
Lift one straight leg upward while keeping the other leg on the floor.
Lower the raised leg with control and switch sides.
Keep your lower back pressed into the floor throughout the movement.

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing the lower back to arch off the floor.
Swinging the legs instead of lifting with control.
Bending the knees during the raise.

exercise.name: Weighted Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Adds external resistance to a traditional crunch, increasing upper abdominal strength and promoting muscle growth through progressive overload.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Hold a dumbbell or plate securely on your chest or slightly overhead.
Crunch upward by contracting your abdominal muscles.
Squeeze at the top, then lower your shoulders slowly with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using a weight that is too heavy, causing poor form or strain.
Pulling on the neck instead of engaging the abs.
Using momentum rather than controlled movement.

exercise.name: Bodyweight Windmill
exercise.whatItDoes: Enhances oblique flexibility, core stability, and shoulder mobility through controlled rotational movement.

executionSteps.step: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and arms extended sideways.
Bend at the hips and reach one hand toward the opposite foot.
Rotate the torso while keeping the other arm extended upward.
Return to standing position and alternate sides.

commonMistakes.mistake: Rounding the lower or upper back.
Failing to keep the upper arm extended overhead.

exercise.name: Front to Side Plank
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds core stability, strengthens obliques, and improves anti-rotational control by transitioning between front and side plank positions.

executionSteps.step: Start in a forearm front plank position with body in a straight line.
Rotate the body into a forearm side plank, stacking or staggering the feet.
Hold briefly while keeping hips lifted and core tight.
Rotate back to the front plank and alternate sides.

commonMistakes.mistake: Poor hip alignment in side plank.

exercise.name: Tuck Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Targets both upper and lower abdominal muscles by combining a crunch with a knee tuck for increased core engagement.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with hands behind your head or resting by your sides.
Lift your shoulders and knees slightly off the ground.
Crunch forward while pulling your knees toward your chest.
Extend arms and legs back to the start position without touching the floor.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using momentum instead of controlled movement.
Pulling on the neck with hands.
Arching the lower back off the floor.

exercise.name: Double Leg Stretch
exercise.whatItDoes: Challenges core stability while stretching and strengthening the entire abdominal wall through controlled extension and contraction.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with knees pulled into your chest and hands on shins.
Extend arms overhead and legs forward at the same time.
Circle arms around and pull knees back toward chest.
Keep the core tight and lower back pressed into the floor.

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing the lower back to arch off the floor.
Relying on momentum instead of control.

exercise.name: Spider Plank
exercise.whatItDoes: Dynamic plank variation that targets the obliques and hip flexors while improving core stability.

executionSteps.step: Start in a high plank position with arms straight.
Bring one knee toward the same-side elbow outside the arm.
Return to plank and switch sides.
Keep hips stable and core engaged.

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing hips to rotate or sag.
Not bringing the knee far enough forward.

exercise.name: Crab Twist Toe Touch
exercise.whatItDoes: Engages the obliques and core while improving coordination through a rotational movement in the crab position.

executionSteps.step: Sit in a crab position with hands and feet on the floor and hips lifted.
Lift one hand and rotate the torso to touch the opposite toe.
Return to the starting position.
Alternate sides while keeping hips elevated.

commonMistakes.mistake: Performing reps too quickly without control.

exercise.name: Quarter Sit-up
exercise.whatItDoes: Beginner-friendly core exercise that targets the upper abdominal muscles using a limited range of motion.

executionSteps.step: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Engage your abs and lift your shoulders slightly off the ground.
Pause briefly while squeezing the abdominal muscles.
Lower back down slowly with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Pulling on the neck with the hands.
Using momentum instead of core strength.
Lifting too high like a full sit-up.

exercise.name: Burpees
exercise.whatItDoes: Full-body explosive movement that heavily engages the core while improving strength, endurance, and conditioning.

executionSteps.step: Squat down and place hands on the floor.
Jump feet back into a plank position.
Perform an optional push-up.
Jump feet forward and explosively jump upward.

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing the lower back to arch in plank.
Skipping full body extension at the jump.

exercise.name: Snap Jumps
exercise.whatItDoes: High-intensity plyometric movement that elevates heart rate while engaging the core for stability and power.

executionSteps.step: Lower into a squat position.
Jump explosively while tucking the knees.
Land softly with bent knees.
Repeat continuously with control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Landing too hard on the feet.

exercise.name: Side Plank Leg Raises
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens the obliques and hip abductors while improving lateral core stability.

executionSteps.step: Start in a side plank position with body in a straight line.
Lift the top leg upward while keeping hips stacked.
Lower the leg slowly with control.
Complete reps, then switch sides.

commonMistakes.mistake: Placing too much load on the shoulder.

exercise.name: Reverse Plank Kicks
exercise.whatItDoes: Strengthens the posterior core, glutes, and shoulders while challenging stability through alternating leg kicks.

executionSteps.step: Start in a reverse plank position with hips lifted.
Kick one leg forward while keeping hips high.
Lower the leg and switch sides.
Maintain a strong and stable plank throughout.

commonMistakes.mistake: Shrugging shoulders instead of keeping them stable.

exercise.name: Bear Crawl
exercise.whatItDoes: Builds core stability, coordination, and full-body strength through controlled crawling movement.

executionSteps.step: Start on all fours with knees hovering just above the ground.
Move forward by advancing the opposite arm and leg together.
Keep your back flat and core tight.
Move slowly and under control.

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing hips to sway side to side.

exercise.name: Russian Twist
exercise.whatItDoes: Classic oblique rotational exercise to strengthen the core and define abdominal muscles.

executionSteps.step: Sit on the floor with knees bent and lean slightly back.
Rotate your torso from side to side in a controlled motion.
Optionally, hold a weight or lift your feet for added challenge.
Maintain proper posture without rounding your back.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using momentum instead of controlled rotation.

exercise.name: Plank
exercise.whatItDoes: Fundamental isometric core exercise engaging the full abdominal region.

executionSteps.step: Place forearms or hands on the ground, keeping the body straight.
Engage core, glutes, and quads.
Hold the position while breathing steadily.
Maintain a neutral spine throughout.

exercise.name: Half Cross Crunch
exercise.whatItDoes: Partial oblique crunch.

executionSteps.step: Lie on back, one knee bent.
Crunch opposite elbow to knee.
Squeeze oblique muscles.
Alternate sides.

exercise.name: Side Plank Rotation
exercise.whatItDoes: Threading rotation for obliques and mobility.

executionSteps.step: Start in side plank position.
Thread bottom arm under your body.
Rotate open back to starting position.
Repeat fluidly on both sides.
